You must use STOCK PARTS, the glider must be SELF SUPPORTING and SELF FLYING. The glider can not go over 3000 meters, and it MUST LAND WITHOUT A PARACHUTE.

Can you do this?

Sorry, clarifying that. I mean a plane that flies on it's own power. These setups usually use wings, hence wind, hence aero.

Wings currently provide some lift but do not function as true airfoils yet.

Arrr!

Capt'n Skunky
if you eject the head as soon as the boosters start to flip, and sas is off, the head starts tumbling, then it corrects itself and starts gliding. Minimal input needed.
How about I make somethign that can make orbit in 30 seconds and fly?

Wait, is the thing supposed to be able to glide hands-off, like with positive stability?

Because I sorta made such a thing a long time ago; I had to wrestle it to about 5 km because it was extremely asymmetrical, but after I got it there I burnt off the rest of my fuel and let it glide by itself. It settled into extremely-tight circles as it gently glided back down to the launchpad area. VERY stable, but unfortunately still too fast to land survivably without power (I don't think it's even possible to manage a safe landing without power or a chute).

How my glider works is that you turn on SAS, Fire the boosters, then as they run out, eject the boosters and SAS module then turn SAS off. The glider will tumble, and then level out. Wait a while, then as the glider starts rapidly losing height, reposition the glider until it stops tumbling, then turn SAS back on. If it loses more height, turn SAS back off. If you get it perfect, then it will slowly drift in a direction, losing height at 1m/s. It will land safely.
